title: Quiz 2 - Mix Data Interpretation
instruction: Directions: Answer the questions based on the information given below. The pie-chart shows the percentage distribution of number of students out of total number students in five different courses and percentage distribution of number of male students in five different courses. Note: a) Ratio of number of students in Arabic and German courses are 1:3, respectively. b) The number of female students in given five courses are 7/15th of total number of students. c) Ratio of number of students in French course to the number of male students in German course is 5:4.

quiz.text: Find the ratio of number of passengers who boarded the train at station ‘B’ and number of passengers who de-boarded the train at station ‘D’.
options: 13:9
12:7
18:11
10:3
9:4

quiz.text: Out of total number of passengers in the train after it left station ‘C’, 50% were females. Find the difference between number of males in the train after it left station ‘C’ and number of passengers who deboarded the train at station ‘B’.
options: 135
215
123
141
None of these

quiz.text: Find the average of the number of passengers who de-boarded the train at stations ‘E’ and ‘F’ together.
options: 212
272
192
152
182

quiz.text: After the train left station ‘D’, each passenger has 3 bags with him. Find the total number of bags with the passengers in the train after it left station ‘D’.
options: 766
512
858
912
353

quiz.text: If at each station, 75% of total number of passengers who boarded the train were males then find the sum of number of all the females who boarded the train at given stations.
options: 194
148
156
172
128

quiz.text: On Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday machine ‘A’ was operated for 6 hours, 4 hours and 5 hours, respectively. On each day, fruits were sold in such a way that each pack contains 5 fruits and all fruits were sold. If the cost of each pack is Rs. 20 then find the total amount earned on given three days.
options: Rs. 5120
Rs. 4800
Rs. 3240
Rs. 6000
Rs. 4200

quiz.text: On each day, for cutting each fruit the machine ‘B’ requires electricity equal to 3 units. Machine ‘B’ was operated for 5 hours on Monday, 4 hours on Tuesday and 3 hours on Wednesday. If each unit of electricity costs Rs. 5 then find the total cost of electricity consumed on given three days together by machine ‘B’.
options: Rs. 13120
Rs. 26250
Rs. 16340
Rs. 28200
Rs. 32450

quiz.text: If on Monday, efficiency of machine ‘C’ decreases by 10 units after each hour and on Tuesday its efficiency decreases by 5 units after each hour. If total number of fruits cut on given three days together from machine ‘C’ is 690 then find the total time for which the machine ‘C’ was operated on given three days together.
options: 15 hours
19 hours
12 hours
5 hours
17 hours

quiz.text: Out of total number of fruits cut by machine ‘D’ in given three days together, 20% got wasted. Operating time of machine ‘D’ in all three days was in AP with common difference 2 hours. Time for which machine ‘D’ was operated on Tuesday is average of time for which it was operated on Monday and Wednesday. Find the time for which machine ‘D’ operated on Monday given that total 1584 fruits were not wasted after cutting.
options: 8 hours
10 hours
76/7 hours
Either 8 hours or 76/7 hours
Cannot be determined

quiz.text: Find the ratio of number of fruits cut by machines ‘A’ and ’B’ together on Monday in 5 hours to number of fruits cut by machines ‘C’ and ‘D’ together on Wednesday in 8 hours.
options: 20:17
15:13
22:25
55:48
None of these

quiz.text: Total amount of money deposited in February was:
options: Rs. 13200
Rs. 4000
Rs. 5200
Rs. 12000
None of these

quiz.text: Ratio of Rs. 20 to Rs. 50 notes deposited in May is:
options: 63:10
20:3
25:11
10:9
None of these.

quiz.text: Total number of notes deposited by Sonia till June was:
options: 1200
1600
2000
1500
None of these

quiz.text: Number of Rs. 20 notes deposited in May was how much percent more/less than that in March?
options: 20%
25%
77(7/9) %
33(1/3) %
None of these

quiz.text: Number of Rs. 50 notes deposited in April was:
options: 40
240
224
252
None of these

quiz.text: Ratio of number of test match, ODI match and T-20 match played between India and Australia in 2013 and in 2014 was 4:5:6 and 2:4:3, respectively. India won 75% and 60% of test match and ODI match, respectively in 2013, while Australia won 70% and 50% of test match and ODI match, respectively in 2014. Find the ratio of number of T-20 match won by India in 2013 to that of same by Australia in 2014.
options: 2:3
8:5
6:7
6:5
5:4

quiz.text: In which year among the given years, Australia had won 2nd highest number of matches?
options: 2013
2014
2015
2016
2017

quiz.text: A batsman namely Pankaj Awasthi played all matches in the given years and average run scored per match by Pankaj Awasthi was 64. If Pankaj Awasthi scored runs in the form of 4’s and 6’s only, and total number of 4’s and 6’s hit by Pankaj Awasthi was 8640, then find the difference between number of 4’s and 6’s hit by Pankaj Awasthi.
options: 4320
4280
4080
4160
4460

quiz.text: In 2018, number of matches played between India and Australia was 25% more than that of same in 2013. If difference between number of matches won by India and Australia was 12 in 2018, then find the percentage of matches won by India in 2018.
options: 54%
46%
60%
42%
Can’t be determined

quiz.text: Number of test match played between India and Australia in 2016 and 2017 was 20% and 15%, respectively out of total number of matches played between India and Australia in the respective years. Which of the following statement(s) is/are true which equals the total number of test matches played between India and Australia in 2016 and 2017 together? I. Number of matches won by Australia in 2013. II. 60% of total matches played between India and Australia in 2017. III. Number of matches won by India in 2014.
options: Only I
Only II
Only III
Only I and II
Only I and III

quiz.text: If the number of male students in French course is 800, then find the number of female students in Spanish course who are above the age of 25 years, such that 60% of total female students in Spanish course are below or equal to the age of 25 years.
options: 240
176
204
154
None of these

quiz.text: If the sum of the number of male students in Arabic and Russian course is 1200, then find the difference between number of female students in the same two courses.
options: 420
240
360
180
520

quiz.text: If the difference between the number of students in Arabic and Russian courses are 60 then find the sum of fees paid by all females students in French course such that each female student paid Rs. 2000 for the French course.
options: Rs. 4,00,000
Rs. 3,20,000
Rs. 3,60,000
Rs. 4,50,000
Rs. 3,00,000

quiz.text: In the question, two quantities I and II are given. You have to solve both the quantities to establish the correct relation between Quantity-I and Quantity-II and choose the correct option. Quantity-I: If total number of students in given five courses is 4500 then find the number of females in Russian course. Quantity-II: If number of female students in given five courses is 2800 then find the number of male students in Arabic course.
options: Quantity-I > Quantity-II
Quantity-I < Quantity-II
Quantity-I ≤ Quantity-II
Quantity-I = Quantity-II or No relation
Quantity-I ≥ Quantity-II

quiz.text: If the difference between the male and female students in given five courses is 800 then find the average of number of male students in French and German courses.
options: 1640
1520
1760
1320
1480
